reviews.review_msg: Although the content is quite dense and lots of reading, Taeyoung is a pleasant instructor in the sense that he tries his absolute best to make sure he's making sense to students and the class is not TOO dull. Very accessible, care about students (he notices if people seem to be tired and hurries to get us out to eat) Totally recommend

I have to say this course is not friendly to students whose English is a second language because the TA will assume that you already know many terms that some "common" senses about doing research in the Western culture. preparing to read a lot of papers!! and write three difficult assignments. Also, there are many lab assignments!!! Good Luck!!
This course is not difficult, but your grades depend on your TA

The lectures are a bit boring but he does his best to bring in interesting examples to liven up the content. The assignments are very well explained and lots of warning before a quiz and even opportunities for bonus marks! It is obvious he cares for students to do well.

The lecture material is dense but I believe Taeyoung did what he could to make the best out of the situation with examples and assignments. He was always accessible for questions, even before the semester had officially started. His quizzes and assignments were straight forward and came directly from lectures, readings, and tutorial.
Lecture recordings are very boring and dull

This professor is amazing! He is a hige advocate for students mental and physical health and is very accommodating, if i did not submit something he even checks in to make sure everythings ok and OFFERS extensions. 10/10 a wholesome guy.
One of the best professors at SFU, if you ever get the chance to take a class with professor Finklestein enroll right away, really flexible and helpful
Rod is an icon at SFU!! I miss his music.

Rod has to be one of the best TAs I've had in my 4 years at SFU. He's thorough, funny, respectful, and you can tell he genuinely cares about his students and their success. He goes very in-depth about assignments and even has a youtube channel where he gives tips for the course. Very kind guy. I had a fantastic experience with Rod.
Really nice guy, with engaging lectures, really uses zooms features. I really miss him this semester, especially the spanish music he plays:((

I really enjoyed his lectures, he genuinely cares about his students. The labs, however, were not the best, So much of the labs felt like a waste of time, where we had assignments and discussions which weren't very fruitful. The assignments weren't too hard but they were poorly explained. The guidelines just complicated the assignment.
